content:
Use this calculator to figure out your concentration after reconstitution and how many units to draw for your dose.
Step 1: Reconstitution Peptide amount in vial (mg) Common: 5mg or 10mg vials BAC water to add (mL) Common: 1mL or 2mL Your Concentration: 2.5 mg/mL Step 2: Calculate Your Dose Desired dose (mg) Draw this much: 10 units (0.1 mL) Quick Reference Tables #Semaglutide 5mg Vial + 2mL BAC Water (2.5 mg/mL) # Dose Units to Draw Volume 0.25mg 10 units 0.10 mL 0.5mg 20 units 0.20 mL 1.0mg 40 units 0.40 mL 1.7mg 68 units 0.68 mL 2.0mg 80 units 0.80 mL 2.4mg 96 units 0.96 mL Semaglutide 5mg Vial + 1mL BAC Water (5 mg/mL) # Dose Units to Draw Volume 0.25mg 5 units 0.05 mL 0.5mg 10 units 0.10 mL 1.0mg 20 units 0.20 mL 1.7mg 34 units 0.34 mL 2.0mg 40 units 0.40 mL 2.4mg 48 units 0.48 mL Tirzepatide 10mg Vial + 2mL BAC Water (5 mg/mL) # Dose Units to Draw Volume 2.5mg 50 units 0.50 mL 5.0mg 100 units 1.00 mL 7.5mg 150 units 1.50 mL 10mg 200 units 2.00 mL Note: For doses above 100 units, you may need a larger syringe or split into two injections.
Tirzepatide 10mg Vial + 1mL BAC Water (10 mg/mL) # Dose Units to Draw Volume 2.5mg 25 units 0.25 mL 5.0mg 50 units 0.50 mL 7.5mg 75 units 0.75 mL 10mg 100 units 1.00 mL 12.5mg 125 units 1.25 mL 15mg 150 units 1.50 mL The Formula #It’s simple math once you understand it:
Concentration: peptide (mg) √∑ water (mL) = mg per mL
Units to draw: desired dose (mg) √∑ concentration (mg/mL) √ó 100 = units
Example # You have a 5mg vial of semaglutide You add 2mL of BAC water Concentration: 5 √∑ 2 = 2.5 mg/mL You want 0.5mg dose Units: 0.5 √∑ 2.5 √ó 100 = 20 units Tips # Less water = more concentrated (smaller injection volume, but harder to measure small doses accurately) More water = less concentrated (easier to measure, but larger injection volume) 2mL is a good middle ground for most people Always double-check your math before injecting Start with lower doses if you’re new to these medications Supplies You’ll Need # Bacteriostatic water Insulin syringes (29-31 gauge) Alcohol swabs Sharps container ‚Üê Back to Reconstitution Guide
Affiliate Disclosure: Some links on this site are affiliate links. If you purchase through them, I may earn a small commission at no extra cost to you. I only recommend products I’ve personally used or thoroughly researched.

content:
How It Works Platforms üö© Red Flags Brand vs Compounded ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: As of late 2024, tirzepatide compounding largely stopped (off FDA shortage list). Most telehealth platforms now offer semaglutide only, or can help you access brand-name Zepbound through LillyDirect. How It Works 1Ô∏è‚É£ Sign up 2Ô∏è‚É£ Health questionnaire 3Ô∏è‚É£ Provider review 4Ô∏è‚É£ Prescription 5Ô∏è‚É£ Ships to you Platform Comparison Platform Starting Price Best For Mochi Health ~$99/mo Budget-conscious Hers ~$199/mo Want hand-holding Henry Meds ~$200/mo Clear pricing Ro Varies Want brand-name Mochi Health # ~$99/month ‚Äî Compounded semaglutide Good mobile app, async provider messaging, generally positive reviews.
Best for: Budget-focused users who want a legit prescription
Hers (Hims & Hers) # ~$199/month ‚Äî Compounded semaglutide + support Established company, includes medical support, heavy marketing.
Best for: People who want a known brand with support included
Watch out: Long-term commitment for best pricing, upselling reported
Henry Meds # ~$200/month ‚Äî Compounded semaglutide Video consultations available, straightforward pricing, good provider communication.
Best for: People who want clear pricing and no surprises
Ro # Pricing varies ‚Äî Can prescribe brand-name Zepbound Can prescribe actual brand medication, integrates with LillyDirect pricing.
Best for: People who want brand medication with telehealth convenience
üö© Red Flags to Avoid ‚úó No provider consultation at all ‚Äî You should talk to someone ‚úó Won't name their compounding pharmacy ‚Äî Legit ones will tell you ‚úó Prices way below market ‚Äî $50/month compounded = suspicious ‚úó Claims to offer compounded tirzepatide ‚Äî Legally questionable now ‚úó Pressure to sign long contracts ‚Äî Month-to-month should be an option ‚úó No reviews online ‚Äî Google them first Brand vs Compounded: Does It Matter? üíä Brand (Wegovy, Zepbound) Made by pharma companies FDA-approved Consistent batch to batch Pre-filled pens or vials More expensive üè• Compounded Made by compounding pharmacies Same active ingredient Regulated by state boards Usually in vials Cheaper Does it work the same? For most people, yes. But absorption may vary slightly. If switching from brand to compounded, pay attention to how your body responds.
The LillyDirect Route #If you want brand-name Zepbound specifically:
1 Use a telehealth platform that prescribes brand (like Ro) 2 Ask them to send prescription to LillyDirect 3 Pay LillyDirect's self-pay prices ($299-449/mo) 4 Medication ships to you My Take #I used Zepbound through LillyDirect during my weight loss phase ‚Äî I wanted pharmaceutical-grade medication while actively losing.
For maintenance, I switched to research peptides because the cost savings matter when you’re on something indefinitely.
Telehealth compounded is a solid middle ground if brand is too expensive and research peptides feel too DIY.
Questions? contact@glp1afterdenial.com
Affiliate Disclosure: Some links earn a small commission at no extra cost to you.

content:
Quick Answer üíä Brand üè• Telehealth üî¨ Research Compare ‚ö° Quick Answer Brand name (LillyDirect) if you can afford $300-450/mo. Telehealth compounded if you want a prescription but cheaper. Research peptides if you're on a tight budget and comfortable with DIY.
First: Understanding the Medications # Drug Brand Names What It Does Semaglutide Ozempic (diabetes), Wegovy (weight loss) Mimics 1 gut hormone (GLP-1) Tirzepatide Mounjaro (diabetes), Zepbound (weight loss) Mimics 2 gut hormones (GLP-1 + GIP) Key insight: Ozempic and Wegovy are the same drug ‚Äî just approved for different conditions. Same with Mounjaro and Zepbound.
üíä Option 1: Brand Name (FDA-Approved) Monthly Cost $299-449 What You Get Pharmaceutical-grade Zepbound LillyDirect Pricing (Dec 2025):
Dose Price 2.5mg (starter) $299/mo 5mg $399/mo 7.5mg - 15mg $449/mo ‚úì Pros FDA-approved, pharma quality Pre-measured doses HSA/FSA eligible Medical oversight ‚úó Cons $300-450/month Requires prescription Vials need syringes Best for: First-timers, HSA/FSA users, those who want pharmaceutical quality.
How to access: Get prescription from your doctor ‚Üí lillydirect.lilly.com
üè• Option 2: Telehealth Compounded Monthly Cost $100-250 What You Get Compounded semaglutide + Rx ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: As of late 2024, tirzepatide compounding largely stopped (off FDA shortage list). Most platforms now offer semaglutide only. Platform Comparison:
Platform Price Notes Mochi Health ~$99/mo Popular, good reviews Hers ~$199/mo Established, includes support Henry Meds ~$200/mo Clear pricing Ro Varies Can prescribe brand ‚Üí LillyDirect ‚úì Pros Real prescription Cheaper ($100-250/mo) Pre-mixed, no DIY Medical oversight included ‚úó Cons Not brand name Quality varies by pharmacy Subscription model No tirzepatide available Best for: Want a prescription but can’t afford brand. Uncomfortable with research peptides.
‚Üí Full telehealth comparison
üî¨ Option 3: Research Peptides Monthly Cost $50-150 What You Get Lyophilized peptide (DIY mixing) Typical Pricing:
Peptide Vial Price Lasts Semaglutide 5mg $80-100 4-8 weeks Tirzepatide 10mg $100-130 4-8 weeks ‚úì Pros Most affordable No prescription needed Tirzepatide available Bulk savings ‚úó Cons No FDA oversight Must mix yourself Calculate own doses No medical supervision Best for: Experienced users, tight budgets, maintenance (like me).
‚ö†Ô∏è Not for beginners. If you've never been on GLP-1 medications, start with brand or telehealth so you have medical oversight. ‚Üí Reconstitution guide ¬∑ ‚Üí Dosing calculator
üìä Quick Comparison Factor üíä Brand üè• Telehealth üî¨ Research Cost/month $299-449 $100-250 $50-150 Prescription Yes Yes No FDA approved Yes No No Convenience Pre-measured Pre-mixed DIY Medical oversight Yes Yes No Tirzepatide Yes No Yes My Recommendation # New to GLP-1s? ‚Üí Start with telehealth or brand. You want medical oversight while learning how your body responds.
Been on them before? ‚Üí Brand if budget allows. Research peptides if you're comfortable with reconstitution.
Budget is #1 concern? ‚Üí Research peptides ‚Äî but only if you've done your homework.
What About Insurance? #Most insurance doesn’t cover weight loss medications. Conditions that can help:
Sleep Apnea PCOS Cardiovascular Prediabetes NAFLD Hypertension My experience: I tried to get Zepbound covered but finding doctors to write prior auths was a hassle, and my insurance didn’t cover weight loss anyway. Self-pay ended up being less stressful.
Questions? contact@glp1afterdenial.com

title: Guides & Resources

content:
Disclaimer: This is for educational purposes. Research peptides are not FDA-approved for human use. I’m not a medical professional ‚Äî just sharing what I learned.
What You’ll Need #From the Peptide Supplier # Lyophilized (freeze-dried) semaglutide or tirzepatide vial Supplies to Buy # Item Purpose Link Bacteriostatic water Mixes with peptide Amazon Insulin syringes (29-31g) Drawing & injecting Amazon Alcohol swabs Sterilizing Amazon Sharps container Safe disposal Amazon ‚ö†Ô∏è Use bacteriostatic water, NOT sterile water. BAC water has a preservative that prevents bacteria growth. Sterile water doesn’t ‚Äî use within 24 hours only.
The Math # Don’t want to do math? Use the Dosing Calculator
The Formula #Step 1: Calculate concentration
peptide (mg) √∑ water (mL) = mg per mL Step 2: Calculate units to draw
desired dose (mg) √∑ concentration (mg/mL) √ó 100 = units Example # 5mg vial + 2mL water = 2.5 mg/mL Want 0.5mg dose? 0.5 √∑ 2.5 √ó 100 = 20 units Quick Reference Charts #Semaglutide 5mg + 2mL Water (2.5 mg/mL) # Dose Draw This 0.25mg 10 units 0.5mg 20 units 1.0mg 40 units 1.7mg 68 units 2.4mg 96 units Tirzepatide 10mg + 2mL Water (5 mg/mL) # Dose Draw This 2.5mg 50 units 5.0mg 100 units 7.5mg 150 units 10mg 200 units Step-by-Step Reconstitution # Step 1: Prep # Wash hands thoroughly Wipe both vial tops with alcohol swabs Let dry 10-15 seconds Step 2: Draw Water # Pull back syringe plunger to desired amount Insert needle into BAC water vial Push air in, draw water out Tap out air bubbles Step 3: Add Water to Peptide #‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: Aim needle at the glass wall, not directly at the powder. Let water run down the side slowly.
Step 4: Mix Gently #DO NOT SHAKE. Shaking damages the peptide.
Swirl gently in circles, OR Just let it sit 5-15 minutes ‚Äî it dissolves on its own Solution should be clear. If cloudy or has particles, don’t use.
Step 5: Label & Store # Write date and concentration on vial Refrigerate (not freezer) Good for 4-6 weeks Injection Technique #Where to Inject # Abdomen
2+ inches from belly button Front of Thighs
Middle, outer area Back of Upper Arms
Fatty area How to Inject # Clean site with alcohol swab, let dry Pinch skin to create a fold Insert needle at 45-90¬∞ angle Release pinch Push plunger slowly Wait 5-10 seconds before removing Don’t rub the site Rotate sites ‚Äî don’t use the same spot twice in a row.
Dosing Schedules #Semaglutide (Typical Titration) # Weeks Dose Frequency 1-4 0.25mg Once weekly 5-8 0.5mg Once weekly 9-12 1.0mg Once weekly 13-16 1.7mg Once weekly 17+ 2.4mg Once weekly Tirzepatide (Typical Titration) # Weeks Dose Frequency 1-4 2.5mg Once weekly 5-8 5.0mg Once weekly 9-12 7.5mg Once weekly 13+ 10-15mg Once weekly üí° Tip: Go slower if side effects are rough. Many people maintain at lower doses than the max.
Common Mistakes # ‚ùå Using sterile water instead of BAC water
‚ùå Shaking the vial (swirl gently instead)
‚ùå Shooting water directly at powder
‚ùå Storing at room temperature after mixing
‚ùå Freezing reconstituted peptide
‚ùå Reusing needles
‚ùå Starting dose too high
Storage # State Where How Long Powder (unmixed) Fridge or freezer Months Reconstituted Fridge only 4-6 weeks Never freeze reconstituted peptide or leave it at room temp.
Side Effects #Common (especially when starting):
Nausea (worst first 1-2 days after injection) Decreased appetite Constipation or diarrhea Fatigue Managing them:
Start low, increase slowly Stay hydrated Eat protein even when not hungry Some people inject at night to sleep through nausea When to Get Help üö® # Seek medical attention for:
Severe, persistent abdominal pain Signs of thyroid issues (neck lump, trouble swallowing) Severe allergic reaction Signs of severe dehydration Questions? # Reach out at contact@glp1afterdenial.com
Affiliate Disclosure: Some links on this site are affiliate links. If you purchase through them, I may earn a small commission at no extra cost to you.

This is especially important if you have:
Diabetes or blood sugar issues Thyroid problems or family history of thyroid cancer Kidney or liver disease History of pancreatitis Any other medical conditions Research Peptides #The information about research peptides on this site is educational. Research peptides are:

title: Medical Disclaimer

content:
TLDR 2022: Ozempic 2024: Insurance Zepbound Now: Peptides Lessons üìã The Short Version Lost 40 lbs on Ozempic (2022). Insurance stopped covering it (2024). Weight came back. Tried to get Zepbound covered but insurance didn't cover weight loss and finding doctors to write prior auths was a hassle. Went self-pay with HSA. Now maintaining on research peptides.
2022: Ozempic Changed Everything My doctor prescribed Ozempic and insurance covered it. I didn’t think much about it at the time.
‚ú® What Happened Lost 40 pounds while working out consistently Food noise stopped ‚Äî first time in my life I wasn't constantly thinking about food Inflammation gone ‚Äî stuff I'd dealt with for years disappeared Ozempic (semaglutide) was approved for Type 2 diabetes. The weight loss was technically a “side effect.” This becomes important later.
2024: Insurance Stopped Covering It As GLP-1s got popular for weight loss, insurers got stricter. Many now only cover them for diabetes, not weight management.
‚ùå My Situation Insurance stopped covering Ozempic Prior authorization wasn't even an option with my plan Policy excluded weight loss medications entirely So I stopped taking it. Figured I’d maintain with diet and exercise.
I was wrong. The weight came back. The food noise returned.
Late 2024: Zepbound (Self-Pay) After gaining the weight back, I knew I needed to get back on medication. I looked into getting Zepbound covered by insurance.
‚ö° The Reality My insurance didn't cover Zepbound for weight loss Finding doctors willing to write prior authorizations was a hassle I knew it was going to be an uphill battle So I skipped the headache. My doctor prescribed Zepbound for weight loss and I went straight to self-pay using my HSA. LillyDirect made it available at lower prices than the crazy list price.
Zepbound vs Ozempic ‚Äî My Experience Ozempic Zepbound Active ingredient Semaglutide Tirzepatide How it works 1 hormone (GLP-1) 2 hormones (GLP-1 + GIP) Strength Effective Stronger Side effects Manageable More intense at first My results Lost 40 lbs over months Lost regained weight in 4-5 months I worked up to 5mg ‚Äî that was my sweet spot.
Now: Maintenance on Research Peptides Once I hit my goal weight, I had options:
Stay on Zepbound at $449+/month forever Try to maintain without meds (already failed at this) Research peptides for maintenance I chose research peptides ‚Äî lower dose, much cheaper ($50-150/month).
‚ö†Ô∏è This Isn't For Everyone Knowing how to reconstitute (mix the powder) Calculating your own doses No medical oversight Comfort with the legal gray area But I’d already been on both medications, knew how my body responded, and only needed a low maintenance dose. It’s working for me.
What I Wish I'd Known üö® Protein and Hair Loss Many people lose hair on GLP-1s. It's usually preventable.
When you eat way less (which these meds cause), you might not get enough protein, water, or vitamins. Hair loss is often the first sign you're undereating protein. Aim for 100+ grams/day.
The Insurance Maze Medication Approved For Insurance Reality Ozempic Diabetes Usually covered with diabetes diagnosis Wegovy Weight loss Rarely covered, requires prior auth Mounjaro Diabetes Usually covered with diabetes diagnosis Zepbound Weight loss Sometimes covered with qualifying conditions Qualifying conditions that can help: PCOS, sleep apnea (Zepbound is specifically approved for this), cardiovascular disease, NAFLD, hypertension, prediabetes.
But be warned ‚Äî finding doctors willing to write prior authorizations can be a hassle, and even then your plan might just not cover it. I eventually decided self-pay was less stressful.
üí∞ LillyDirect Pricing (Late 2025) 2.5mg: $299/month 5mg: $399/month Higher doses: $449/month Not cheap, but way less than the $1,000+ list price. HSA makes it pre-tax.
Where I Am Now ‚úÖ At goal weight üíä Low-dose peptides üèãÔ∏è Consistent exercise ü•© High protein Is this the “right” approach? I don’t know. It’s what’s working for me.
What's Next? Compare Options Full breakdown Telehealth Which are legit Reconstitution How to mix Questions? contact@glp1afterdenial.com
Affiliate Disclosure: Some links earn a small commission at no extra cost to you.

Your email address and message content That’s it. No accounts, no tracking cookies, no selling your data.

Other affiliate programs: Similar deal ‚Äî once you click to a partner site, their privacy policy applies.
Cookies #This site uses minimal cookies:

Email me to ask what data I have about you (probably nothing) Ask me to delete any data I have Opt out of any emails (just reply and ask) Contact #Questions about privacy? Email me at contact@glp1afterdenial.com
Changes #I’ll update this page if anything changes. No sneaky stuff.
